Problem:
Consider a system represented by a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\), where \\( x(t) \\) and \\( y(t) \\) are real functions of time, described by the differential equations \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\), with A and B being constant scalars. Analyze the effects of the transformation \\( f(z) = e^{Ct}z \\), where \\( C \\) is a complex constant.

Can the original complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 be deduced after observing \\( z(t) \\) at t = T without knowing whether \\( f(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without information on whether the transformation \\( f(z) \\) was applied and the value of \\( C \\), it is impossible to uniquely determine \\( z_0 \\) because the exponential transformation could have modified its initial magnitude and phase in an untraceable way.
